column4: so i'd like to build a server for my new place and am considering using ubuntu but the lack of gui is a bit spooky.. can ubuntu server 7.04 i386 handle gnome?
i'm not, i love CLI i just don't know it solidly enough yet to manage a server
i figured if gnome was there as a backup, i'd have no problems learning it

for what it's worth, the tutorials and support documents for server tasks are all going to be command-line only anyways. The GUI wouldn't do you much good even if you had it. That said, Ubuntu desktop can to all the server tasks anyways. If this is for a home application, just do what you want on Desktop, then you have your GUI.
